page.title: 15Whipsande/Places of Worship
page.content: There has been a CHURCH in Whipsnade since Anglo Saxon times,the present one since the 16th Century.Standing just off the picturesque village green it is built in brick,the earliest in the Tower are Roman.Extensive restoration work has been done in the last few years costing over Â£35,000.A new peal of bells has been installed. There are 53 names on the Electoral Roll & each Sunday about 25 people attend services.The TREE CATHEDRAL was the brain child of Maj.E.K.Blyth who planted it in memory of 3 friends killed during the l914-18 war.It is in the shape of a cathedral with nave, spring,easter,winter & lady chapel, cloisters,all grown with appropriate trees.There are services for any denomination.It now belongs to the National Trust with a part time warden & voluntary workers keeping it tidy.
